question: DUS Testing Facility is associated to _?
explanation: DUS stands for distinctness, uniformity and stability (DUS) of new varieties of plants for the purpose of granting the Breeders' Right. The new variety should be distinct from the other varieties for at least one characteristic to pass in the DUS test. The authority has DUS monitoring centres. The breeder is required to deposit the seed or propagating material including parental line seeds of registered variety to the Authority. The DUS test is done for a fee of Rs. 20,000/- and other applicable fees. The person after getting the right can sell the seeds / propagating material in his / her name.
